oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Excerpt from Molle Mystery Theatre - 1944-01-25 ; Excerpt from the NBC War Bond Parade - Grand Ole Opry - 1944-02-05
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpt from the January 25, 1944 broadcast of Molle Mystery Theatre, episode 20 entitled The Thursday Turkey Murders, featuring Bernard Lenlow as Geoffrey Barnes. Excerpt from the February 5, 1944 broadcast of the NBC War Bond Parade on the Grand Ole Opry, featuring the Duke Of Paducah and Roy Acuff and His Smoky Mountain Boys. The NBC War Bond Parade has a correlating item in the archive located with call number TR000647.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) [Blank] / (4:55) [Unidentified bird sounds and music] / (5:39) Geoffrey Barnes [played by Bernard Lenlow] advertises next week's episode of Molle Mystery Theatre [incomplete] / (7:02) [Unidentified announcer] talks [incomplete] / (7:11) Introduction for NBC's War Bond Parade in Nashville, TN featuring Duke Of Paducah and Roy Acuff / (7:33) Duke Of Paducah announces the opening statements / (7:58) Roy Acuff and His Smokey Mountain Boys perform "Wait For The Light To Shine" [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Duke of Paducah, 1901-1986; NBC War Bond Parade (Radio program); Mystery theater (Radio program); Acuff, Roy, 1903-1992
